title: Charlotte gears up for storm : Hardware stores see surge , county Monitors water levels
message:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (WBTV) - Charlotte residents are preparing for the approaching storm as local groups work to ensure they’re ready to respond.
Tim Trautman, the Mecklenburg County Stormwater Program Manager, highlighted a network of sensors and cameras monitoring water levels in real-time.
These systems become crucial during heavy rainfall events, alerting authorities to areas at risk of overflowing creeks and subsequent road closures.
Trautman warned that last week’s storms brought water levels halfway up the banks of some creeks, raising concerns about potential flooding with the expected rainfall.
“They communicate messages to our staff as well as our emergency managers, so that they can decide where to deploy resources.”Local hardware stores are experiencing a surge in storm preparation supplies.

title: Colorado wildfires : Evacuations lifted , containment grows
message:
Hundreds of Front Range residents returned home this week after increasing containment allowed fire officials to lift mandatory evacuations for the Quarry and Alexander Mountain wildfires.
Fire crews reached 100% containment on the Quarry fire Wednesday afternoon, a swift jump from the 45% containment as of Tuesday morning.
Containment on the Alexander Mountain fire grew to 91% Wednesday, and Larimer County officials lifted all mandatory evacuation orders and reopened U.S. 34 between Loveland and Estes Park.
Heavy rain over northern Colorado on Wednesday afternoon prompted National Weather Service forecasters to issue flash flood warnings for the Alexander Mountain and Stone Canyon burn scars.
In areas where fire burns hot or long enough, soil develops a water-repellent layer that reacts like rain on pavement, weather officials said.

title: Malaysians in areas affected by southern California earthquake urged to remain vigilant
message:
PUTRAJAYA: Malaysians in areas affected by the earthquake in southern California are urged to remain vigilant and adhere to safety guidelines issued by local authorities, said the Foreign Ministry.
According to a statement, the Foreign Ministry, through the Consulate General of Malaysia in Los Angeles, is actively monitoring the situation following a 5.2-magnitude earthquake that occurred near Bakersfield, Southern California.
"The Foreign Ministry will continue to closely monitor the developments and provide updates as necessary to ensure the safety and well-being of all Malaysians in the affected regions,” the statement read.
According to the Foreign Ministry, Malaysians requiring consular assistance can contact the Consulate General of Malaysia in Los Angeles at 777 South Figueroa Street, Suite 600, Los Angeles, California or telephone +1-213-892 1238 or email mwlosangeles@kln.gov.my.
"As we continue to handle the ongoing Atlantic hurricane season, including monitoring Tropical Storm Debby in Florida, we are extending our vigilance to the earthquake effects in California,” the statement added.

title: 7 . 1 magnitude earthquake strikes coast of Japan , tsunami advisories triggered
message:
7.1 magnitude earthquake strikes coast of Japan, tsunami advisories triggeredLONDON -- A strong earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 7.1 has rocked the coast of southern Japan as tsunami advisories have been triggered in the region, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.
The epicenter of the earthquake is just a dozen miles off the coast of the city of Miyazaki on the island of Kyushu in Japan.
Miyazaki, with a population of approximately 400,000 people, is now on alert for potential tsunamis in the aftermath of the quake.
The Japan Meteorological Agency issued a tsunami advisory, predicting waves of up to 1 meter (3.3 feet) along the southern coast of Kyushu and nearby island of Shikoku.
People have been urged to stay away from the coast or river and have been warned that other quakes -- even on the same magnitude --may occur.

According to the National Weather Service, the storm is expected to continue to move northeast, bringing heavy rainfall to parts of South Carolina, North Carolina, and Virginia.

Flooding has been reported in the Charleston, South Carolina area, and some schools and businesses were closed due to the storm.

The National Weather Service has issued several watches and warnings for the area, including a flood warning for the Charleston area.

The storm is expected to continue to weaken as it moves north, but it still has the potential to cause heavy rainfall and flooding in parts of the region.

message:

The storm, which had 50 mph winds, made landfall near Bulls Bay, South Carolina, the National Hurricane Center said in a 2 a.m.

When it was still out to sea off South Carolina at around 5 p.m., the storm was affecting weather from Florida to the Carolinas and into to the Mid-Atlantic states, Brennan said.
An EF-1 tornado associated with an outer rain band of the tropical storm damaged roofs of homes on the Isle of Palms in South Carolina on Tuesday, the weather service said.

title: Clarkton residents worry about canal flooding as Tropical Storm Debby moves through
message:
Clarkton residents worry about canal flooding as Tropical Storm Debby moves throughCLARKTON, NC (WWAY) — In Bladen County, there are growing concerns about inland flooding from Tropical Storm Debby.
In the town of Clarkton, some residents are worried the canals won’t be able to move all the rainwater away from their homes.
Some areas of Clarkton flooded earlier this week after a storm, which caused a tree to fall into one of the canals.
Clarkton resident Rhonda Caballero said she feels the town didn’t do enough after Hurricane Florence to prevent flooding of the canals again.
Prior to Debby, I was at a meeting at a church in town and I could not get back to my home.

message:

Brian Kemp has extended the State of Emergency for all 159 counties in Georgia until August 15.

title: USDA Meteorologist , Brad Rippey : Debby took the best ag route possible through the southeast
message:
What is left of Hurricane Debby is bringing a lot of rain to the south and east coast.
Southeast Georgia and coastal Carolina saw rain totals of anywhere from 10-20 inches, leading to historic flooding and a devastating end to the growing season for some farmers.
While the rain has caused concern, some say the moisture was needed because the summer heat caused crop conditions to decline drastically.
USDA Meteorologist Brad Rippey says that Debby took what could be considered the best ag route possible so far this week.
“Initially from an agricultural standpoint, Debby moved through about the best possible area you could take a hurricane through the southeastern United States.

title: China self - developed intelligent platforms enhance marine early warning , forecasting capabilities
message:
As Typhoon Gaemi approaches, huge waves pound the shore in Yilan, China's Taiwan island, on July 24, 2024.
Photo: VCGChina has made significant progress in developing advanced intelligent tsunami monitoring and early warning platforms in recent years.
It has the ability to quickly determine preliminary earthquake parameters within three to five minutes, and then transmit these parameters in real time to the tsunami warning system, triggering the corresponding warnings.Compared to early systems that could only make forecasts based on human experience, current systems can provide quantitative forecasts of tsunami arrival time, wave height, and warning levels for different coastal locations, as well as corresponding response measures.According to Wang, the system integrates real-time ocean data from over 600 stations worldwide, including along the coast of China.
It can complete parameter calculations for these regions in about three minutes, shortening warning times.In addition, the system, with the help of a global observation network, has specially configured buoys for tsunami monitoring.
Relevant departments in the field of natural resources will continue to deepen the strengthening of the marine warning and forecasting system, actively promoting the steady improvement of its forecasting capabilities.Global Times
event_breakdown: As Typhoon Gaemi approaches, huge waves pound the shore in Yilan, China's Taiwan island, on July 24, 2024.

title: Death Toll Rises As Tropical Storm Debby Makes Second U . S . Landfall
message:
Tropical Storm Debby made its second U.S. landfall in South Carolina early Thursday (August 8), bringing with it life-threatening floods and a deadly tornado in North Carolina.
The storm, which had already caused significant rainfall in parts of the South, made landfall near Bulls Bay, South Carolina, with winds of 50 mph, according to the National Hurricane Center.
Debby was a Category 1 hurricane when it first made landfall near Steinhatchee in Florida’s Big Bend region on Monday.
In North Carolina, a tornado spawned by Debby heavily damaged Springfield Middle School in Lucama, along with four homes and a church.
The storm is expected to continue to weaken as it moves inland but is not forecast to leave North Carolina until Thursday night or Friday.

3. Tropical Storm Debby is expected to continue to weaken as it moves inland but is not forecast to leave North Carolina until Thursday night or Friday.

Tropical Storm Chris forms in the Atlantic, likely to become hurricane
Tropical Storm Chris formed off the coast of the Carolinas on Monday evening, churning northward on a path that could take it east of Bermuda by the end of the week.

Chris is the 2nd named storm of the 2018 Atlantic hurricane season and is expected to strengthen into a hurricane, the National Hurricane Center reported.

As of 5 p.m. Monday, the storm had winds of 40 mph, making it a tropical storm. Predictions are that if it continues to develop, the storm's winds could strengthen to around 80 mph in the coming day. The storm is expected to miss the United States, but Bermuda is within its predicted path.
Currently, the storm is moving north-northeast, and is centered about 290 miles southeast of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina.

title: A powerful earthquake hits off southern Japan ; tsunami advisory issued
message:
A powerful earthquake struck off Japan's southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
Residents were urged to stay away from the coastline, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or serious damage.
The agency said tsunami waves of up 50 centimetres (1.6 feet) were detected along parts of Kyushu's southern coast and the nearby island of Shikoku about a half hour after the quake struck.
Earthquakes in areas with nuclear power plants have been a major concern since a massive earthquake and tsunami in March 2011 triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster.
An earthquake on January 1 in Japan's north-central region of Noto left more than 240 people dead.
event_breakdown: Japan's Meteorological Agency issued an advisory for a tsunami up to 1.6 feet (50 centimeters) in coastal regions of the southern Kyushu island and the neighboring region of Shikoku. The 5.0-magnitude earthquake struck on Thursday morning.

title: Debby makes second landfall in South Carolina as it marches northward
message:
Debby makes second landfall in South Carolina as it marches northwardWorld World Debby makes second landfall in South Carolina as it marches northwardThe system could spawn tornadoes in the region on ThursdayFollow on Updated On: Thu, 08 Aug 2024 23:08:19 PKTATLANTA (Reuters) - Tropical Storm Debby made a second landfall northeast of Charleston early on Thursday as it dumped more rain on coastal South and North Carolina, exacerbating fears of flash flooding in areas already soaked by the slow-moving weather system.
Debby, which has killed at least seven people, was located about 80 miles (125 km) southeast of Charlotte, North Carolina, and 110 miles (180 km) southwest of Raleigh, on Thursday morning.
Rainfall totals could reach 15 inches (38 cm) in southeastern North Carolina and 10 inches (25 cm) in parts of Virginia.
An apparent tornado killed one man when his house collapsed as it tore through eastern North Carolina and damaged at least 10 houses, a church and a school in Wilson County, North Carolina, early on Thursday morning, county officials reported on social media.
By the weekend, Debby could produce up to 6 inches (15 cm) of rain from Maryland into northern Vermont.

title: Hurricane season : 2024 mid - season forecast while reflecting back
message:
A person looks out toward the flooded interstate after Hurricane Beryl swept through the area on July 8, 2024, in Houston, Texas.
Hurricane season for the Atlantic basin season runs from June 1 to Nov. 30, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).
Colorado State University and NOAA both published forecasts that suggested 2024 would be an active hurricane season in part from the sea surface temperatures reaching record-level temperatures.
To take a step back and reflect on the 2024 hurricane season, here are landfall dates, wind speed and precipitation images from the season, which kicked off with the first named storm, Tropical Storm Alberto, on June 19.

title: Tropical Storm Debby makes 2nd landfall in South Carolina , heavy rain expected up the East Coast
message:
Tropical Storm Debby makes 2nd landfall in South Carolina, heavy rain expected up the East CoastHUGER, S.C. (AP) — Tropical Storm Debby spawned damaging tornadoes, flooded a town and temporarily shut down part of Interstate 95 early Thursday as it blew into North Carolina after making a second landfall overnight.
The National Hurricane Center says Debby came ashore early Thursday near Bulls Bay, South Carolina.
It was still a tropical storm Thursday morning, with maximum sustained winds at 50 mph (80 kph).
Debby also could bring more tornadoes Thursday in parts of North Carolina and Virginia, forecasters said.
Moisture from the tropical storm strengthened another system Tuesday evening, which caused strong thunderstorms, according to weather service meteorologist Scott Kleebauer.

title: A powerful earthquake hits off southern Japan ; tsunami advisory issued
message:
TOKYO (AP) — A powerful earthquake struck off Japan’s southern coast on Thursday, triggering a tsunami advisory.
Residents were urged to stay away from the coastline, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or serious damage.
The Japan Meteorological Agency said the quake registered magnitude 7.1 and was centered in waters off the eastern coast of Japan’s southern main island of Kyushu at a depth of about 30 kilometers (18.6 miles).
The agency said tsunami waves of up 50 centimeters (1.6 feet) were detected along parts of Kyushu’s southern coast and the nearby island of Shikoku about a half hour after the quake struck.
Earthquakes in areas with nuclear power plants have been a major concern since a massive earthquake and tsunami in March 2011 triggered the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

title: Bangkok Post - Damage minimal after strong quake off Japan
message:
But officials investigating whether risk of trench-type ‘megaquake’ is increasingPeople gather on a street after an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.1 shook Miyazaki in southwestern Japan on Thursday.
(Photo: Kyodo)TOKYO - A powerful earthquake with a magnitude of 7.1 shook southwestern Japan on Thursday afternoon but no major damage was reported and only relatively minor tsunami waves reached the coast.
The quake occurred at 4.43pm local time at a depth of around 30 kilometres off Miyazaki prefecture.
Services on the Kyushu and Nishi Kyushu shinkansen bullet trains were temporarily suspended due to the quake, the operator said.
It said it has started investigating whether there is a link between the temblor and a potential massive trench-type “megaquake” along the Nankai Trough off western and central Japan.

title: Japan earthquake : Authorities issue MEGAQUAKE warning for the first time ever after tremors earlier in the same area  one of the world deadliest earthquake hit nearly 80 years ago
message:
Japan has issued its first ever megaquake warning following tremors earlier today in the same area 'one of the world's deadliest earthquakes' hit almost 80 years ago.
The 7.1 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Japan's southern island of Kyushu, close to the city of Nichinan, at 4.43pm local time.
The most recent quake to hit the area was 78 years ago in December 1946.

message:

title: Megaquake  warning issued by Japan after 7 . 1 magnitude earthquake
message:

Graphic courtesy of the Japan Meteorological AgencyAfter a 7.1 magnitude earthquake impacted the Miyazaki Prefecture at 4:42 p.m. local time (3:42 a.m.
ET) today, Japan has issued the first “megaquake” warning for fears of a massive earthquake in the Nankai Trough.
In the future, if a large-scale earthquake occurs, it is expected to generate strong shaking and high tsunami waves.
The odds make a large-scale earthquake occurring in the Nankai Region relatively high compared to normal times.
event_breakdown:
Japan has issued its first “megaquake” warning for the Nankai Trough, a chain of seafloor trenches off the coast.

The Nankai Trough is part of a zone of tectonic activity called the Tokai-Tonankai-Chubu Metropolitan Area, which is due for as big earthquake.

If it does hit, it has the potential to cause severe destruction and tsunami waves along Japan’s populated coastal cities, including the densely populated capital Tokyo.

message:
However, the quake prompted seismologists to hold an emergency meeting in which they reassessed and raised the level of risk of major quakes associated with the Nankai Trough east of southern Japan.

title: Japan issues advisory over possible Nankai Trough earthquake - Nikkei Asia
message:
Following the afternoon quake, the Japan Meteorological Agency launched investigations into its possible relationship to a potential Nankai Trough earthquake, which experts have warned for years could cause huge loss of life and property across a wide stretch of central and western Japan.
The agency issued its Nankai Trough Earthquake Extra Information for the first time ever on Thursday evening.
The agency urged caution for a week, with the probability of large earthquakes being higher just after the Miyazaki quake.
The agency said a Nankai Trough earthquake may be limited to the vicinity of Thursday's quake or extend over the "entire Nankai Trough."
It was not immediately clear if the heightened Nankai Trough earthquake risk would impact his plans.
event_breakdown: Japan is facing heightened risk of a Nankai Trough earthquake following a string of major earthquakes and a tsunami warning in the Pacific. The Japan Meteorological Agency has issued the first ever Nankai Trough Earthquake Extra Information. The agency warned that large earthquakes were more likely over the next week, and urged caution.

title: Tropical Storm Debby makes second landfall in South Carolina , bringing rain , tornadoes
message:
LAUREN SFORZA –Tropical Storm Debby made its second landfall Thursday in South Carolina as it continues to batter the East Coast with heavy rains and strong winds.
As of Thursday morning, more than 7,000 households are without power in South Carolina, and more than 137,000 have outages in North Carolina, according to poweroutage.us.
Debby first made landfall in Florida as a Category 1 hurricane but has since weakened into a tropical storm.
The center said that the storm currently has sustained winds of 45 mph, keeping it in the tropical storm category.
The NWS added that tropical storm conditions will affect parts of the coastal Carolinas through Thursday and that flooding in the area due to the storm surge is possible.
